intro: Labichea nitida var. pinnata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed labichea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or scrub habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
